comments.body:
Why define a type for this at all if you're using `typeof child_process.spawn`?
Alternatively, either define a type for spawn everywhere, or just use the type from child_process - I don't think it makes sense to do both.

The issue here is that, using `typeof child_process.spawn` here causes incompatibilities with `namespace spawn`.

This is the only way to use both `namespace` and `function`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@ * command line arguments in `args`. If omitted, `args` defaults to an empty array.
 */
declare function spawn(command: string, options: child_process.SpawnOptions): child_process.ChildProcess;
declare function spawn(
	command: string,
